definitions: To write or name the letters that form (a word) in correct order.
To constitute the letters of (a word).
To result in; to lead to.
To take the place of (someone) for a period of time, allowing them to rest.
To relieve (someone) of a task or duty for a period.
To work for a period of time.
examples: Can you spell your name for me?
I'll spell you for a bit so you can take a break.
The relief pitcher came in to spell the starter.
He spelled for an hour before heading home.
